Actions.description: The available actions for this resource.
Actions.longDescription: This type shall contain the available actions for this resource.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

DataProtectionLoSCapabilities.longDescription: The capabilities to protect data from loss by the use of a replica. The requirements shall be met collectively by the communication path and the replica. There should be one instance associated to a class of service for each replica. Each replica independently should have a class of service that describes its characteristics.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Actions.description: The available actions for this resource.
Actions.longDescription: The Actions property shall contain the available actions for this resource.

Identifier.longDescription: The value shall be unique within the managed ecosystem.

Links.description: Contains links to other resources that are related to this resource.
Links.longDescription: The value of this property shall contains links to other resources that are not contained in this resource.

Oem.description: This is the manufacturer/provider specific extension moniker used to divide the Oem object into sections.
Oem.longDescription: The value of this string shall be of the format for the reserved word *Oem*.

SupportedLinesOfService.description: Collection of known and supported DataProtectionLinesOfService.
SupportedLinesOfService.longDescription: The collection shall contain known and supported DataProtectionLinesOfService.

SupportedMinLifetimes.description: Supported minimum lifetime that replica must be maintained.
SupportedMinLifetimes.longDescription: The value of each entry shall be an ISO 8601 duration that specifies the minimum lifetime required for the replica.

SupportedRecoveryGeographicObjectives.longDescription: The value of each entry shall specify a supported failure domain.

SupportedRecoveryPointObjectiveTimes.description: Supported time intervals defining how much source information can be lost on failure.
SupportedRecoveryPointObjectiveTimes.longDescription: The value of each entry shall specify a supported ISO 8601 time interval defining the maximum source information that may be lost on failure. In the case that IsIsolated = false, failure of the domain is not a consideration.

SupportedRecoveryTimeObjectives.description: Supported expectations for time to access an alternate replica.
SupportedRecoveryTimeObjectives.longDescription: The value of each entry shall specify an enumerated value that indicates a supported expectation for the time required to access an alternate replica. In the case that IsIsolated = false, failure of the domain is not a consideration.

SupportedReplicaTypes.longDescription: The value of each entry shall specify a supported replica type

SupportsIsolated.description: Allocating a replica in a separate fault domain is supported.
SupportsIsolated.longDescription: A value of true shall indicate that allocating a replica in a separate fault domain is supported. The default value for this property is false.

FailureDomainScope.description: Values of this enumeration represent a geographic scope of a failure domain.

enumDescriptions.Datacenter: A co-located set of servers, including network and storage that share communication, power, or cooling infrastructure.
enumDescriptions.Rack: A container for Servers, Networking, and Storage.
enumDescriptions.RackGroup: A set of Racks that share common infrastructure.
enumDescriptions.Region: A geographical or politically isolated set of resources.

enumLongDescriptions.Datacenter: A facility that provides communication, power, or cooling infrastructure to a co-located set of servers, networking and storage.
enumLongDescriptions.Rack: A container within a datacenter that provides communication, power, or cooling to a set of components.
enumLongDescriptions.RackGroup: A set of racks that may share common communication, power, or cooling.
enumLongDescriptions.Region: A set of resources that are required to be either geographically or politically isolated from resources not in the resources.
enumLongDescriptions.Row: A set of adjacent racks or rackgroups that may share common communication, power, or cooling.
enumLongDescriptions.Server: Components of a CPU/memory complex that share the same infrastructure.

FailureDomainScope.longDescription: The enumeration literals of this enumeration shall represent a geographic scope in which all components within that scope have similar vulnerabilities.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Oem.longDescription: This object represents the Oem property.  All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification.

SupportedReplicaOptions.description: Collection of known and supported replica Classes of Service.
SupportedReplicaOptions.longDescription: The collection shall contain known and supported replica Classes of Service.

OemActions.description: The available OEM specific actions for this resource.
OemActions.longDescription: This type shall contain any additional OEM actions for this resource.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

RecoveryAccessScope.description: An enumeration that represents the relative time required to make a replica available as a source.

enumDescriptions.Nearline: Access to replica via a different front-end interconnect. A restore step is required before recovery can commence.
enumDescriptions.Offline: No direct connection to the replica. (i.e. To a bunker containing backup media.)
enumDescriptions.OnlinePassive: Passive access to replicas via the same front-end interconnect.

enumLongDescriptions.Nearline: Access to a replica shall be consistent with switching access to a different path through a different front-end interconnection infrastructure.  Some inconsistency may occur.  A restore step may be required before recovery can commence.
enumLongDescriptions.Offline: Access to a replica may take a significant amount of time.  No direct connection to the replica is assumed. Some inconsistency loss may occur.  A restore step is likely to be required.
enumLongDescriptions.OnlineActive: Access to synchronous replicas shall be instantaneous.
enumLongDescriptions.OnlinePassive: Access to a synchronous replica shall be consistent with switching access to a different path the same front-end interconnect.  A restore step shall not be required.

RecoveryAccessScope.longDescription: The enumeration literals shall represent the relative time required to make a replica available as a source.

title: #DataProtectionLoSCapabilities.v1_1_2.DataProtectionLoSCapabilities
